reasoning: Knicks catastrophically injured - KAT out/doubtful, McBride out, Anunoby questionable (potentially 48+ PPG compromised). Detroit 20-6 at home (76.9% win rate) and just demolished NYK by 38 yesterday. Even with B2B fatigue for both, the talent disparity is massive.

OKC missing SGA (31 PPG MVP candidate), Williams, Holmgren, Dort, and Mitchell - essentially their entire core. Houston has Durant and Sengun healthy. Thunder's elite 22-4 home record built with full roster is irrelevant against this skeleton crew.

OKC lost ~50 PPG of production to injuries. Houston averaging just 96 PPG last 2 games. Both teams in offensive slumps with slower pace expected from OKC's makeshift lineup. Line adjusted down but not enough given the magnitude of missing firepower.

Elite team (31-21, +12.7 net rating) vs league's worst team (12-41) on 11-game losing streak. Kings missing 4 starters (Sabonis, LaVine, Murray, Hunter) - essentially fielding a G-League lineup. Cleveland 8-2 L10 with Mitchell healthy and dominant. Even without Mobley, the talent gap is massive. Our ratings_edge bets are 6-1 (85.7%).

H2H average total only 204.0 with just 12% of games going over 220. Clippers lost Harden/Zubac in trade and missing Beal/Garland - their offense is severely depleted. Combined pace projects to ~101.2, below league average. Our totals are 3-0 (100%).
